thread.title: Nowhere to fly - this is non stop Lufthansa today
thread.title_full: Nowhere to fly - this is non stop Lufthansa today

author: eTN Managing Editor
title: Nowhere to fly - this is non stop Lufthansa today
text:
Nowhere to fly - this is non stop Lufthansa today Original, timely global, travel, tourism, business news and research: 
Sep 09, 2015 eTN Exclusive: Unique and original, timely, global breaking news: 
Star Alliance airline member Lufthansa means strike. It's a second day today pilots at German Lufthansa is grounding around 1,000 flights and affecting 140,000 passengers. The bad news is more strikes would come if management did not improve their offer in a row over cost cutting. 
All in all, the Lufthansa Group had some 3,000 flights planned for today. Of these, 1,520 flights with 180,000 travelers booked on them were to have been operated by Lufthansa. And 1,350 of these are short- and medium-haul services. Despite the strike action, over 500 Lufthansa flights are operating. The services of Germanwings, SWISS, Austrian Airlines and Brussels Airlines are not affected, and will operate as scheduled. 
Lufthansa’s long-haul network is also seeing some cancellations. Fifty-two of the 176 long-haul services planned for Wednesday 9 September are cancelled as a result of the strike action, partly because – as a consequence of yesterday's strike. The aircraft concerned are not yet back where they need to be to operae services as scheduled. 
Lufthansa had tried to stop the strike, the 13th in 18 months, with a temporary injunction but on Tuesday night two courts ruled in favor of the pilots’ union, Vereinigung Cockpit. 
The pilots are striking over retirement benefits, pay and Lufthansa’s plans to expand low-cost operations. They want Lufthansa to halt the expansion of Eurowings, which has an Austria operating licence, while negotiation 
German employers’ association BDA said the strikes were damaging the entire German economy and the aims of the pilots were legally questionable.
